whatIsService.title: What is Postnatal Hair Loss?
whatIsService.content:
**Postnatal (postpartum) hair loss** - often called **postpartum shedding** - is a common concern for many new mothers. The sudden hair thinning or reduced volume occurs due to hormonal shifts after childbirth. While usually temporary, it can be distressing without the right care.

At The Skin Firm, we offer **new mothers hair loss treatment**, combining medical expertise with safe, lactation-friendly solutions. Our treatments, from **postnatal hair fall solutions** to advanced **hair regrowth after pregnancy**, are designed to be gentle, effective, and customised.

With the guidance of a trusted **dermatologist for postnatal hair loss**, we focus on restoring scalp health, improving follicle strength, and encouraging natural regrowth.

signsConcerns.title: Signs & Concerns Postnatal Hair Loss Treatment Can Treat
items: Sudden increase in hair shedding (large clumps when brushing/washing)
Noticeably thinner hair or reduced ponytail volume
Patchy or uneven regrowth after childbirth
Weak, brittle, or lifeless hair post-delivery
Scalp sensitivity or poor scalp circulation affecting follicle recovery
Hair texture changes following pregnancy or breastfeeding

downtime.title: Downtime After Postnatal Hair Loss Treatment
downtime.description: **Minimal to none** for most treatments.\nPossible mild scalp tenderness, pinkness or sensitivity for a few hours (usually resolves within 24-48 hours).\nNo long hospital stays or heavy recovery - most mothers return to normal routines the same day.

postCare.title: Post-Care After Postnatal Hair Loss Treatment
tips: Use gentle, baby-safe or dermatologist-recommended shampoos.
Avoid heat styling, chemical treatments (colour/straightening) for a few days.
Delay strenuous scalp massage or heavy oiling for 24-48 hours after injections.
Maintain protein-rich, iron-sufficient diet; consider supplements only after clinician review.
Protect scalp from prolonged sun exposure; follow any topical/serum instructions provided.
Attend scheduled follow-ups for progress checks and next sessions.

faqs.title: FAQs on Postnatal Hair Loss Treatment

questions.question: Q. Is postnatal hair loss normal?
questions.answer: Yes. Many women experience increased hair shedding after pregnancy due to hormonal changes. It’s usually temporary but can be distressing without proper care.

questions.question: Q. When does postnatal hair loss usually start and how long does it last?
questions.answer: Hair shedding typically begins around 2–4 months after delivery and may last up to a year. With the right **Postnatal Hair Loss Treatment**, the duration and severity can be significantly reduced.

questions.question: Q. Is the Postnatal Hair Loss Treatment safe for breastfeeding mothers?
questions.answer: Absolutely. At The Skin Firm, all treatments are carefully chosen to be safe, gentle, and suitable for postnatal and breastfeeding mothers.

questions.question: Q. What treatments are available for postnatal hair fall?
questions.answer: Options include mesotherapy, growth factor therapy, PRP, and nutritional support - all designed to strengthen roots, boost regrowth, and improve hair density.

questions.question: Q. When will I see results after my Postnatal Hair Loss Treatment?
questions.answer: Most patients notice reduced shedding within 1–2 months of treatment. Visible regrowth and fuller hair can be expected with consistent sessions over 3–6 months.

questions.question: Q. Do I need to continue the Postnatal Hair Loss Treatment for long-term?
questions.answer: The number of sessions depends on the extent of hair fall. Many women benefit from an initial treatment plan followed by occasional maintenance sessions.
